Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: katherynemc
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in a triple room. Small but clean with nice amenities. Spacious, very nice bathroom. Second floor breakfast room offered the usual assortment of pastries, juices and cereals plus an automatic espresso machine. We only ate in the immediate vicinity once at Il Secchio (not a memorable experience) but there are a number of restaurants close by. Two blocks from the train station, very convenient to metro, airport and trains. It's a good 15 minute walk to the Coliseum/Forum. I would stay here again, good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: ekellylou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for three nights. The rooms were very clean. Small, but that's expected. Marco at the front desk is the best! He recommended several good restaurants in the area and was very friendly and entertaining. There was a good selection for breakfast. This hotel is very close to the Termini train station and metro and it was very convenient to get around the entire city. We rode the metro everywhere! Several other reviewers had recommended the Ristorante Santi close by, but beware if you get the tourist menu there. We were shorted two courses and the food was not very good. Try Trattoria Elettra next to the hotel (excellent) or the one across the street. Also, for those who use a hair dryer to style your hair, take your own hair dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Patty H
Reviews.Content: Like others said the room was very small, but we weren't needing more room since we didn't plan to be in the hotel much. I was afraid first sitting on the bed that I would find it hard, but it was very comfortable. Very clean room. Loved the service from everyone from the maid to the concierge. They were always very helpful and willing to explain things. They gave great directions and recommendations. Honestly it was the service in this hotel that made it the best for us. Breakfast was yummy. I had been told not to expect much from Italian hotels because they were continental. I was pleased with the variety and the quality of the food. Wifi worked well (except if you are standing at the concierge desk). Even the 3g on my kindle. Loved the distance to the termini. It was easy to get from there to the Vatican and other places we visited out of the tourist area of Rome. The hotel we a nice walking distance from the collesium and other places. It was a heavy walking day, but using Rick Steve's audio tours we were able to walked from our hotel see the collesium, forem, do the Jewish ghetto walk and Travestere walk and see the Trevi Fountain and back to the hotel in one. day. It might not be what others would have liked, but it was perfect for us. One thing to note: I can't say if we got a good "value" from this hotel as it was part of the package our travel agent set up for us and we don't know the price that was paid for it. We only know we didn't find the hotel lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, modern shower”
Reviews.Author: satellitesue1
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the smallest room I have ever stayed in, that said, I still consider our time here well spent. The gentleman on the front desk was friendly and helpful, the breakfast was descent and I got a kick out of the old fashioned elevator, I haven't seen one of those since I was a little girl. The bathroom was by far the nicest amenity and I really enjoyed the shower, we also thought the location was pretty good for seeing the sights in Rome. It seems as though ice is a luxury in the Termini area and it wasn't until our second day that we were able to get a few cubes to chill our drinks (I think the gentleman on the desk made them for us himself overnight). The hotel is nice and clean and we slept well but I probably wouldn't stay here again due to the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate clean !”
Reviews.Author: houzolos
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to all means of transport,nice restaurants & also tourist attractions (Santa Maria Maggiore, Colosseum, Via Veneto, Opera house etc). Adequate breakfast. Small triple room but immaculate clean and recently renovated. Ask for a room looking to the inner yard, if you are a light sleeper....(pretty much noise of the tram passing beside the hotel )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: calvin e
Reviews.Content: A perfect little find after a terrible ordeal with another hotel across the road. The Serena is perfectly located with an excellent standard of accommodation at a very reasonable rate. The staff could not do enough for us during our stay. Ra'ed is a gentleman and a scholar!! The breakfast served in the morning suits all tastes and was well presented. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain”
Reviews.Author: Risto_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Serena is clean, friendly hotel, just two blocks from Stazione Termini. Termini surroundings have developed huge amount since, let´s say five years ago. There has been done new traffic arrangements and it´s nowadays clean in many ways. Hotel Serena has one of the best so called continental breakfast if thinking these kind of reasonable price hotels. This time price per day was 65 including breakfast and wireless internet. Connection wasn´t the best possible all the time but anyway working most of the time, some difficulties occure during using Skype video calls. Soundproofing could be better. It may variate depending on location of the room. Now it was faced to the backyard and somehow was a little bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Sparra9032
Reviews.Content: Couple, 50's . Cannot fault this hotel spotlessly clean , very helpful staff ,polite and informative, only down side no tea coffee facility in room and not available elsewhere in hotel . Little tip ! Turn right out of front door, cross the road and turn left , little restaurant first on right , fantastic, for 10 euros 3 courses and bottle of wine , nice elderly couple .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the station with great staff and super breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: COGR
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Bookings.com though it was recommended by Road Scholar and I did research it on TA prior to selecting it. The Serena is a typical small hotel in a commercial building, and when they called it a "single" room they weren't kidding! You won't be able to spread out, that is for sure; I can't speak for the doubles. Even so, it had a new TV, a frig and adequate bathroom and was very squeaky clean. High enough up to diffuse street noises. The staff was exceptionally helpful and got me all the train schedules I needed and advised me on best times to visit local attractions. Breakfast was ample and delicious. I can't find anything negative to say about this place. Got it for 95 euros/night which was a better price than others I checked.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nellieabcd
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Roma at Christmas and the hotel Serena is a wonderful family oriented place to stay. Very clean rooms and a delightful breakfast with a wonderful staff. Hopefully, we will stay there again this holiday. Very good location, very helpful and informative front desk. the Restaurant just across the street is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: DorothyLorek
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Serena Hotel in December 2011. It's a 3 star hotel with perfect location very tiny room and ants... We woke up one morning to find ants all Over our toilet floor, and our bed. We were moved to a different room but that should never happen. Wifi Internet connection was very slow and we had to get a different password every morning which was a bit annoying. Would I recommend this hotel to anyone well as I said location is ok but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an average location”
Reviews.Author: srk123
Reviews.Content: Had a 2-nt stay in November by myself. Booked here to be close to the Termini train station, which is a very short and easy walk. Neighborhood is OK but not great. They offer free wi-fi, but I had trouble getting it in my room, but they have cheap internet cafes across the street. Breakfast was good, but not great. Front desk staff was very helpful in answering my travel questions and outlining on a map how to get to a requested site. Reservation was OK with no problems and room was ready when I arrived. Room was small, but that was expected for the price I paid (E65 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: MinMunich
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel one month in advance with the hotel website but when I arrived front staff informed me that my reservation is canceled because of some problem with my credit card without any warning of any kind. They offered to find me new hotel in the neighborhood but I felt too terrible to let them do anything for me. I managed to find a new room at hotel across street from this hotel and my credit card is working just fine. Book this hotel, if you wanna have the same experience as me.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great for all transport links.”
Reviews.Author: S D Evs
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was ideal for our trip to Rome. We booked a triple room [313] as our 15 year old daughter was with us. The room was spotlessly clean with a lovely bathroom, nice toiletries and towels were changed everyday. Plenty of room for us and the beds were great and the 2 huge feather pillows were the best I've slept on for many a year. Marco at reception was just about the best I've come across for help, he was more than willing to help with anything we asked for, gave him a nice bottle of red for his help. The breakfast was ok, it does need to improve, coffee machine is average, making tea was the best option we found. Fruit juice, fresh fruit, excellent pastries and croissants, yoghurt,plenty of jams, cheese and hams were good, the bread was poor and the selection of rolls very average. There were also some cakes which were very nice but I do like some sort of egg for breakfast and maybe some toast. The area around the hotel is great, plenty of reasonably priced eateries, Il Secchio around the corner does a 12 euro tourist 3 course meal which was excellent, also a half litre of house wine for 4 euro, it was really nice. The main train and bus station is only 2 minutes walk away so when in it's vicinity you see a varied selection of Romes inhabitants, we saw no trouble or any unsavoury incidents and there was never a time when we felt uncomfortable in the area, it was just very busy. The one thing to remember if you like a drink, coffee in Macdonalds 1 euro, anywhere else extortionate, beer is even worse except off a street vendor where you can get a can for 2 - 3 euros. Eat or drink anywhere on a piazza and prepare yourself for a shock, but that's Rome. We had a great weekend and would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to access the city”
Reviews.Author: Cornerturned
Reviews.Content: The staff were really helpful with city info. The breakfast had a nice selection. It was very easy access to Termini and a variety of diverse trattorias.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: john q
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent 5 day stay at the Serena Hotel. The room was small but clean, we did little in the room but sleep. The hotel was convient to the Termini station and close to a variety of good restaurants. We utilized Green sightseeing bus the first day to get our bearings but after that we walked to the various sights except the Vatican for which we used the metro. The wi-fi worked altjhough you had to change your password daily. Marco at the front desk was very helpful and always joking. The daily breakfast was good. I would reccomend this hotel to all

Reviews.Title: “A really crappy place. Avoid at all means!”
Reviews.Author: SNGV
Reviews.Content: My experience with Serena Hotel was a rather disappointing one (and I have stayed at quite a few Roman hotels of different type). I have not seen any upsides (even location is somewhat questionable), so I will concentrate on what I found terrible about the place. I booked a singe room with a big bed (queen size) – that was the only reason why I chose the hotel. The one that was given to me was a tiny (this I can handle) room with a narrow twin bed (which I hate). The worst thing about the room was that it awfully smelled with sewage. I complained about the smell and was given another room with a queen size bed. The room was not exactly clean. I found hair in the sheets. Furthermore, the worst thing about this hotel was that I had a really bad allergy on my eyes after using their towels. I could not open my eyes in the morning. They were red and itchy and achy for a few days. My ophthalmologist explained to me that it must have been a detergent with which the pillow cases and towels are washed what caused the allergy. One more thing that struck me about the hotel was their visiting policy. They refused to allow my colleague in the hotel to help me with the luggage unless he left a passport with the receptionist (which of course was out of the question as I can not imagine a reasonable person who would leave his/her passport at such a creepy place). I guess they had some “moral” concerns about the visitors but I felt deeply insulted. Furthermore, given how uncomfortable their staircase and elevator were I had a really hard time dragging my luggage between the floors without any help. My recommendation – stay out of this hotel at all means!

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mo54
Reviews.Content: The Serena Hotel is just two streets away from the Termini Station, ideal for trains, buses and metro, which is only 4 euros for the whole day! The Serena is a small, friendly place with great restaurants and bars nearby. The rooms are all en suite and have everything you need. The bed was one of the most comfortablest my husband and I have ever slept in, in any hotel or B&B, and the rooms are cleaned every day! The staff are all friendly and very helpful. The breakfast area is on the small side, and can get a bit awkward when trying to get from the buffet area to a table, but no big deal really.It is on a busy road and can be a bit noisy with traffic at night, but we just closed the shutters over and slept like babies. I read a review that there were several sex shops nearby, we saw one right next door to us, but we hardly ever noticed it when walking by, so it didn't bother us in the slightest, anyway, it was not much different from the Ann Summers shop windows.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: AGNESSSE
Reviews.Content: We have stay in this hotel for 3 nights. Hotel was nice and clean. Room was small, but nice decorated and comfortable. Breakfast also was good as in 3 stars hotel! This hotel location is average...near the Termini station, so strange neighborhood:) Near the hotel You can find several sex shops and lot of kebabs cafes:) In Roma are lot of old and dingy hotels and Serena hotel is enough modern and cozy. I think it's good choice to stay in Rome. Furthermore Roma is amazing city, so You don't spend in hotel much time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel! Definitely NO!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian S
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives us the most awful experience ever and our trip is half ruined thanks to their "nice, helpful " staff. We booked a standard room but they would not allow us to check in as according to their rules they only allow one person to stay in the room. We try to discuss and figure out something with them since it is very late at night and we are really really exhausted from the trip--flying all the way from the States. But everything is a no. They would not give us a double room, and they would not help us to solve the problem at all. Finally we end up in another hotel next door----------However, they still charged our card for the room we are not even allowed to check in!!!! We try to discuss with the staff but it is useless: he is indifferent, accusing, would not listen at all, far from being helpful while trying to hide from the fact that they've already charged the card. (and declining our access to the room!!!) This hotel is a big disappointment, because of them, we end up at the airport for the last night due to the low budget and it is the worst ever. Also the cleanliness of the hotel is very doubtful as during the short 20-min stay we saw at least one gigantic cockroach roaming around right behind the staff's back, who kept on repeating he absolutely cannot let us check in while he still, definitely has to charge the card.... DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL, YOU WILL BE SORRY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Lobogris43
Reviews.Content: It's all about expectations. Roma is expensive and you can get ripped off quickly and easily. The Serena is solid, clean, safe and literally at the doorstep of the Termini train station and within walking distance of the forum and the national museum near Piazza Republica. The beds are hard, the rooms are small, the showers are smaller and the included breakfast is basic but adequate. All this for less than 100 euros a night in Roma is a bargain. On the plus side, there is a room safe, a mini-bar refer and a/c that works in the summer. The staff is friendly and helpful. Marco, in particular, was of enormous assistance with maps, suggestions and info on everything from good places to eat to where to buy a SIM card for a cell phone. Watch him though, he is an incurable tease and will pull your leg with a straight face worthy of a professional comedian - truly a fun guy who enjoys his job and enjoys tourists (again, an exception for Roma). We have stayed at the Serena four times now and have never had a bad experience (although street noise can be a problem - bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper).

Reviews.Title: “Just about adequate....”
Reviews.Author: Guitarzilla74
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not excel at anything. The rooms, while clean, were quite small. The breakfast was basic even for a continental. The breakfast room was no where near big enough and I was surprised at peak times to find guests waiting for a free table! The surrounding area was just ok, on the fringe from the rough side of the railway station. 15mins brisk walk to the main attractions which was ok. On the whole a pretty non descript, forgettable soulless hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yokerite
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for it's location. 5 mins from Termini station. Excellent hotel, good size rooms, exceptionally clean. Good buffet breakfast and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. A good selection of eating places on the door step. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Largest, nicest bathroom of our trip”
Reviews.Author: WanderLSP
Reviews.Content: It's a nice, clean, no frills budget hotel. Very close to the train station. Had the best bathroom of our trip. American sized which is great for my American sized 6' 8" husband :)

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JtravelsDC
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, you could do much worse. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. And still big enough to be able to unpack and move around a little. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious and had great water pressure, nice sized towels, etc. It was downright pretty, too, with lots of mosaic tile work. Breakfast was continental style and had a great selection of pastries, yogurts, meats, etc. and tasty espresso and hot chocolate. It was always ready earlier than the advertised time (very nice on the day we had to leave at 7am to get in line for the Vatican).

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: loobylouSomerset
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and will definitely recommend to others. Its only about 5 minutes walk from the railway station and pretty easy to find. The duty manager was absolutely charming and welcomed us warmly. We had booked a disabled room for my mother but in fact it was just a single room with no walk in shower. Our double room was clean and spacious as well as feeling homely. We wanted to bring the bed home with us, it was king sized and gave us wonderful nights sleep. The shower cubicle was quite small was adequate. The one thing we missed was a kettle so take your own if you need a cuppa. Being near the station I wondered about noise but we heard none. Breakfast was a buffet continental of high standard. The Serena is so well placed, about 20 minutes walk from the colisseum and forum and probably the same to the Trevi fountain. Being so close to the station meant we had easy access to the buses which are so easy to use, just remember to buy your ticket first and swipe once on. There are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants nearby, all the ones we tried were excellent. There is also a great mix of nationalites and ages which we loved. The duty manager made our stay, he was so courteous to my mother and had great fun teasing our three teenagers who adored him We threw coins into the Trevi fountain so when we go back, here's where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ESLIM61
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel whenever I am in Rome. Very clean and good value. Near to Main Railway Station. Easy by train from airport and walking distance to almost all attractions. Good restaurants just outside, supermarket and market nearby.Has to book early.

Reviews.Title: “A Stop in Rome”
Reviews.Author: yagirlflo
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Located 3 minutes from the termini which made it easy for us to get to from the airport. The hotel in general was kept clean. The room was small but was also very clean. It was weird that you had to use your room key to power the room. We had a view of the back of the hotel, which wasn't much of a view. They had free wireless, which was very good. We had a Continental Breakfast everyday and it was okay, cereal, fresh cuts, fruit, pastries, it was enough to get you started with your day. Check in was simple and check out was just as simple. Enjoy my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, cozy hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Rashroush
Reviews.Content: We were 3 friends stayed for 5 nights in Serena Hotel: 1) The Location was excellent few minutes from the main station (Termini) that connects you to A & B Metro lines and the train to the airport and other trains going to other cities within Italy. there were lots of restaurants and convenient shops nearby, it feels safe to walk there by night, and its not very far (20-30 min walk) if you decided to take a walk to the main attractions in Rome like the Colosseo or Fontana de Trevi or Spagne steps.. 2) The breakfast was not the best, but it was good enough for a start of the day. Our triple room was really nice & tidy and clean, it was also relatively big compared to usual triple rooms in 3 star hotel. The room had an inside view to other nearby buildings, so the noise was minimum, the AC was really strong so we had it turned off for the night. The elevator was one of the things I really liked the most, its the kind you see in old movies where you have to close the exterior metal door manually first before the electronic interior closes, however keep in mind if the exterior door was open in any floor the elevator stops.. I attached a picture to this review. 3) The staff was helpful and very friendly, they gives you tips and advices no matter what you ask them. I definitely recommend this hotel, its a good value for money, you will enjoy Rome in comfortable friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to train station”
Reviews.Author: lemurlg
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. After 3 gruelling flights from the westcoast of Canada (3 flights because I was flying on points, so not direct at all), I arrived completely exhausted and was happy to find that my little room was in the back of the hotel and very, very quiet. Very clean, good location, just a few minutes walk to the Termini and easy to walk to many places of interest. The people at the front desk, particularly the nice man who was there when I arrived, were all really kind, polite, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was an ideal choice”
Reviews.Author: vassia_p
Reviews.Content: It was really important for us to stay in a clean hotel and Serena was one of them. Very clean, comfortable room, everyday room service, decent breakfast. It is remarkable that the staff was really kind, pleasant and helpful. It was 2 minutes walking from the central metro station, the bus station and a mini market. In general, a very good choice in a reasonable price regarding the hotel prices in Rome. Don't eat to the opposite restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but needs some updates”
Reviews.Author: JGP321
Reviews.Content: 5 minutes from the train station and metro, so that is a plus. Small entry with no reception area. Staff though were always very friendly and helpful, and spoke good english. Rooms were adequate size as well as the bathroom. Furniture needs some updating and especially the hairdryers, which must be very old. Bring your own. TV didn't work but I didn't care because were were not in the room that much. Good bed, hot water, clean, etc. Breakfast was very good as was their breakfast staff. Eating area nice. Street outside redone for only limited car usage one way, opening up more room for the restaurants for outside seating. Restaurants on street very good and especially the bakery down the street. Easy access to the metro and walking distance to the Colosieum. Unfortunately a shop next door sells somewhat of sex clothing. Otherwise area seemed safe with plenty of people outside, even being two blocks from the train station. Also easy access to hop on hop off bus. Great WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Kezza54
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights and the location of this hotel is excellant to get around Rome, the station is 3-5 mins walk, I used the hop on hop bus which was excellent to get around on. Staff very helpful, no internet but plent of internet cafes around, I had a very small room, thank goodness I was not in it long( approx 2.5 x 2.5mts) a good budget hotel, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica1217
Reviews.Content: For a 3-star hotel the staff makes you feel like it's so much more. The staff is well-informed in travel and tourist information of the area. They made our stay very easy and accommodating for the 3 nights we spent there. For travelers on the move, as ourselves, it was walking distance to Roma Termini train station as well as the bus terminal. We weren't looking for much more than a place to sleep and breakfast in the morning, but the rooms were ready on time and they were very clean! Definitely a great place for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LibrarianTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is crammed in with dozens of others on this street. Our room was small but clean, as was the bath - plenty of water pressure and hot water in the shower. The bathroom included an electrical outlet that was switchable to 110 to use hair dryers, recharge batteries, that sort of thing. Breakfast was average. The problem with the hotel is the location. The street itself is safe enough, and there are plenty of decent restaurants on the street, but when you leave, the hotel staff will advise you to head up to Via Corso to walk into the historic district. We ignored them, - briefly. The side streets during the day have a lot of people on them who don't look particularly friendly. Toward the train station is a little better, but that's not saying much. If you can find something closer to the historic center, do so.

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: lizjuric
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend for school spring break to Italy. We looked for a hotel close to the main Roma Station and found Hotel Serena! This hotel is everything I read on tripadvisor! The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the station with lots of cute Italian restaurants and Doner kebab takeaway places, all within walking distance. Although the rooms are small, I have to say it’s very clean as is the bathroom. The bathroom looked newly refurbished! Breakfast is average but good by Italian standards. The staff are the best and I’m sure the most friendly of all the hotels in the area and their wifi service was great! If we ever come back, I will for sure choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Budget Hotels”
Reviews.Author: RomaClanEire
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Wife here during our 25th Wedding Anniversary celebrations. I have been to Rome before attending football games but never stayed at this particular Hotel. The rooms are small which is a common theme in many of these Hotels, however the place and rooms were spotless! Breakfast was the usual continental fare and there was no problem with peace and quiet at night time. Proximity to termini could not have been better plus it was quite close to some of the Irish pubs I frequented in the past. I suppose it all boils down to what the Customer wants! i saw one newly arrived lady from the U.S. who was getting quite distressed that her room wasnt ready and had some issues about internet access! However from experience I know the Staff can be pretty "laid back" about these things. Overall I was pretty impressed, would have no problem in returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location.. nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Nakkoush
Reviews.Content: We've been there last summer during a holiday... - Location is excellent (close to public transportation and several highlights...) - Clean - Quiet district - Breakfast is good - Nice staff All over, I would definitely recommend this place....

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but the bathtub had issues”
Reviews.Author: blackbeauty181
Reviews.Content: The rooms in Europe as a expected were small as well as the bath room but we did not spend alot of time in them except for sleeping and showering. The room was clean, had no iron but it seems all the hotels we went to in europe didn't have irons either(wierd). The bathroom was huge, bigger than mines in the States, the only real draw back was that the bathtub didn't have a curtain but half door, yes i said half door(one of the pictures on this site shows what i mean). It was a bathtub/shower combined with half the tub being covered by a half glass door. When we took showers because there was only half a door water got everywhere it was ridiculous. We took the train from Paris to Rome so the location was great because it was 2 blocks away from the train station which has all kinds of shops and the metro station to take us to other parts of Rome. No internet at all, free or a fee but they have internet cafes all over. Had no problems sleeping but we were on the 4th floor so when the elevator broke down our last day we had to drag our heavy luggage down 4 flights of stairs and the front desk did not offer to help, go figure! Other than that the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: jelena_on_travel
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, very close to Termini station, with many restaurants in neighbourhood. Rooms are small but very lovely designed and clean. Breakfast is continental, typical Italian. Man on the reception is very polite and helpful. I would suggest this hotel as well for young and old people. We would certainly come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: mamimmie
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip abroad. I have always dreamed of going to Italy and Hotel Serena helped to make a dream come true. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and nicely decorated. Loved the elevator! Location was good with many places to eat and shop nearby.The train station is only a block away. I was a little nervous at first after reading some of the reviews about the area but, we felt completely safe and welcomed. Already wanting to plan a return trip and we will stay at Hotel Serna!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DavidJeffrey
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome 3 times now, and had always been hesitant to stay near the Termini due to guidebook reviews of the area. Rick Steves mentions "colorful characters". Still not real sure what that means, but definitely felt safe during the entire stay. It was absolutely perfectly located. I was with siblings (age 35-65) and my 85 y.o. mother. The rooms were clean and quiet. Bathrooms were excellent (small, but typical for Italy). The receptionists were very pleasant and helpful. The best thing was the location of this hotel - about 3 blocks from the Termini which I took with my mother for most of our sightseeing, yet within about a mile from most of the sites we went to...Colleseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps which some of the others in our group decided to walk to. Breakfast was typical for Italy - was nice to have it right there and not have the additional expense and hassle of eating elsewhere. Would definitely recommend this to others! Glad I finally got around to doing the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mary91GR
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really clean, which according to my opinion is the most important. Every day the room was cleaned and the towels replaced. The staff was very kind and helpful with everything. Marco is the best receptionist guy ever! The location was excellent, once it was 5 minutes from Termini station, and also in a safe area. We were three girls in the room and initially we thought that we would be uncomfortable because the room was a little small, but finally there was no problem with that either. Breakfast was satisfying. Concluding, this hotel had excellent quality in the main things, without being luxury. Which of course is normal as it's also cheap! I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nummynum
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for good value in Rome you would be hard pressed to find better than the Serena. It is right around the corner from Termini (airport bus,hop on hop off bus etc,metro). There are numerous restaurants and bars in the area and I felt very safe walking in area at night(its does look dodgy but hey thats Rome). Yes the rooms are small but they are very clean and quiet. Breakfast was fine. Shower was strong and bed was comfortable. With beers costing on average €8 a pint save your spends for beer and food and stay here. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family travelling to Rome.......

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalucy73
Reviews.Content: They staff at the desk at night are beyond friendly and helpful (and funny). The rooms are nice and it is close to Termini and easy walking distance to the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel that won't offend”
Reviews.Author: Icarus092
Reviews.Content: Though it's no Hilton, you'll be getting good value for your money with this one. We stayed three nights. The hotel rooms are comfortable and spotlessly clean though some of them tend to be very small. We had to switch the room during our three-night stay which was kind of dumb but the new one we got was bigger so we did not complain too hard. If possible avoid rooms on the lower floors facing the Via Principe Amadeo street as they tend to be very noisy and smelly from the many restaurants down below including one particularly unappetizing Kebab house. Even rooms higher up (5th floor) that are facing the street are very noisy (though no longer smelly) - you won't sleep with open windows for sure though with the air-conditioning fortunately working, this should not be too much of a problem. Can't confirm what other revieweres said about walls being paper-thin - either had civilized, quiet neighbors or just a very hard sleep. The breakfasts are bland but mostly serve their purpose with an assortment of semi-fresh white bread, croissants, just one type of cheese and ham, limited fruit, no vegetables. The breakfast room is open till 10am though unless you are staying outside the main season you really want to get there by 8:30am at the latest to get a free table as the room is small with just several tightly packed tables that can't keep up with the full hotel population. The staff was friendly and speaks English, will give you many useful tips if you ask for them. The location is fine, don't trust the stories from other reviewers about drunkars and prostitutes on the street. Although the area around Termini is surely not the prettiest part of Rome, we never felt unsafe with my wife walking the streets even after 10pm at night. There are many budget restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel that offer good value for money which is nice considering that they are mainly frequented by the tourists. The main (red) metro line is immediately accessible and will carry you directly to most of the main tourist sites including Vatican. On the other hand, if you are not too keen on being intimately squashed by the hordes of tourists in the ever-overfilled metro train cars, you will still be able to access many tourist sites within a walking distance. The Colosseum and the surrounding highlights are just 15 mins away with a nice walk through the Terme di Traiano park. In the hotel lobby you'll find handy complimentary one-page maps of Rome that indicate the hotel's location making sure you never get lost. If you travel from the Fiumicini airport, the train shuttle is just 500m away leaving every half an hour (the trip takes about 30 minutes).. The fellow tourists keeping you company in this hotel are mostly civilized with the usual mix of mainly Germans, Americans, Spaniards and French - usually in couples. All in all, a good budget hotel that won't offend you and the convenient location will save you a lot of time and hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Tremini Station”
Reviews.Author: Needs11
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is decent. The hotel room is small but clean. You can walk to some of the major sites in Rome, or take the metro or tram that is very close to the hotel. One thing that I found odd was they controlled the AC in the room and kept it at a certain temp. so when it reached a certain temp it would turn off and I usually like my room a little cool so the room would get a little hot at times. I would open the window but I was facing a restaurant so I heard pots and pans and plates banging a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie6362
Reviews.Content: Great Location - walking distance to Termini. Good airconditioning when 38 degrees in Rome, Clean, comfortableand helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Good for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Shajen
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and comfy, located within a walk from most places we wanted to visit! Breakfast was nothing to write home about but their are loads of great cafes around the area. We missed the tea and coffee in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel, spotlessly clean, friendly staff, great central location.”
Reviews.Author: DeliaHampshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 302 with my parents in a 3 bed room for 8 days. The room was really clean and had a high standard of decor. The towels and bed linen were changed regularly and the bathroom, shower, was fully tiled and spotlessly clean. Marco on reception was so helpful I tried my pigeon Italian on him and he was appreciative but spoke great English. He helped us with directions, bus numbers, restaurants, taxi return to the airport and was a friendly face to come back to at the end of each day. The hotel breakfast was all you could wish for with regards continental style breakfasts with the staff constantly filling up the croissants and bread baskets. I picked this hotel because of its location, only a 150m from the main bus and rail stations. It worked out so well for us because you don't need a long walk after a long day. Around the hotel are lots of really nice reasonably priced restaurants for example you could get a pizza/pasta and a beer for 10 euros. I would definately recommend this hotel to friends, family and anyone who wants a good quality hotel in the centre of Rome and I would most definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Polite staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Huks
Reviews.Content: + Clean rooms, incl. bathroom + Good breakfast + Qualitative room cleaning + Polite staff - Lack of welcome suite (information about tv channels, minibar prices, telephone numbers of services like taxi, reception etc. )

Reviews.Title: “Made our first night in Italy a dream”
Reviews.Author: Jill_Mark_OHIO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Hotel Serena in Rome. And we wished we could have stayed longer. The staff was wonderful. They were able to get us into our room early, once it was ready. The room was thoroughly modern, clean and very comfortable. The entire hotel was chic. Breakfast was a satifying continental breakfast. And the location is perfect for getting to Roma Termini, the Colosseum and transport to the rest of the city. We slept in quiet and were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Location, cleaniliness, service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: carsondalton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within walking distance from Termini station and on my Iphone found it out easily without requesting for directions. The rooms are very clean though small. Mini bar is reasonably priced and the TV is small. The shower is comfy though at times there was a drainage issue with a mild smell due to drainage issues. We got a baby cot and the room was spotless when we returned after a hectic day of tour. Brekfast was good though a bit too sweet for our taste. The receptionsit and staff are all very courteous. There are many restraunts, supermarkets and shops located close by and the grand termini station to get local busses, trams and trains. We got a total return on our cash and is very highly recommneded!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, cleanliness and value!”
Reviews.Author: UnionSquareDaddy
Reviews.Content: Yes the room was small but I left in the morning and came back in the evening to bath and sleep. The hotel is spotlessly clean and well kept. The bathroom was new and the room itself appeared recently refurblish. The breakfast was a typical european CB. I would return to this hotel for sure when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ice_Angel_NL
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, just a couple of streets from Termini station (with busses, trains and a subway). Plenty of restaurants nearby. We were greeted by a friendly man at the reception. The room wasn't very big, but it was big enough for 2 persons and very clean. The tv was old but it did work. There were also rooms with a new flatscreen tv btw. The bathroom was clean as well and big enough. The shower worked like a charm. Breakfast was ok and typical for Italy. Expect a lot of sweet food (!). It was a bit strange that we got an actual iron 'key' to the room and not a plastic keycard. That meant we couldn't operate the airconditioning, but as we visited the hotel in January that wasn't a problem. A bit of noisy at night (cars on the street etc), but I guess thats in all the major cities around the globe. Basically this is just an excellent hotel for the money you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Train station and Metro - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffCarter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and nice - for the location. It is near the Termini station which makes it extremely convenient. Rome is small so walking anywhere is also possible. This area of town is little seedy but there is safety in numbers. There is a quaint and cool old-fashion elevator that takes you up and a nice stair case. Breakfast room is nice and smoke-free. The room was very neat and clean, but small (as in most european hotels). My bathroom was surprisingly large compared the other room by friend had. I had a single room - just big enough for a bed - but we were only sleeping here. Our rooms faced the front street which was noisy all night long (sidewalk restaurants and bars outside). I had an ipod to drown out the noise, and am used to traffic (I live near and interstate in the DC area). My friend did not get much sleep. I am sure she could have asked to switch rooms, so it must not have been that bad for her. The desk clerks were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is location just around the corner from the Termini Train station which worked out perfectly for us seeing as we arrived and left from Termini. Even though we were warned that it is not a safe area at night, I have to say that we did not have any problems when we came back to our hotel late at night. Rooms are a little small, but they are clean and we were out all day so it did not really matter. There is a mini bar and a hair dryer in the bathroom. The breakfast is not that wow, but from my experience breakfast in Italy is not that great in any hotel. You had the usual coffee, tea, hot chocolate (from a machine), juice, bread, jam, cereal, cheese, cold cuts and croissant. The staff were always helpfull and pleasant. The hotel has a few restaurants very near. If you like to walk it is not far from the main locations (15 mins), but to the Vatican it would take around 40 mins walking.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying there”
Reviews.Author: ivyliac
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close to Termini where you could get connections to trains, metro, buses, trams etc. The room was cleaned everyday although there was a small problem as there was a smell of the sewage which seemed to go away when having a bath and water was running through the pipes. Our room faced the back yard which was not worth opening the window but who cares as we were out all day. The staff were very polite and helpful. The buffet breakfast was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL, TOP CLASS, ALL ROUND..STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jill-02-07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late September 09, Didnt really know what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised!! It's a small hotel with a very old fashioned lift which I think made it! We were on the 4th floor in a twin room which was quite small, bed were right beside each other! But we were only there to sleep so it didnt matter! The room had a nice size wardrobe, tv, minibar, bathroom was lovely and clean with a hairdryer too!! There is a fantastic restaurant just across the road from the entrance of the hotel, staff there were lovely & the food was fantastic, I recommend the Spag Bol!! There are loads of shops just around the corner, nearer to the bus/train station... It's a good trip to the vatican etc from this hotel but when we return we will be staying here! We got taxi's everywhere during the 1st few days but next time we will buy our 2 day ticket for the bus tours, as u can get on and off wherever u like and they work out much cheaper!! Breakfast wasnt my idea of breakfast! But all the same it kept us going until our next meal! It consists of tea, coffee, juices (which u couldnt drink!!) Croissants, bread, fruit, yoghurts & 2 or 3 selections of cereal.. We will definitely be staying here again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone, its not a 5 star hotel but for the price its clean, warm & staff are adorable!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyBiker
Reviews.Content: Located not even a five minute walk from Termini station Hotel Serena proved to be a Little Gem. The place is super clean and the staff go out of their way to help you. Called for tickets to attractions and even helped us with bus numbers and routes. We are 2 senior couples who enjoy traveling and this was our 4th trip to Rome and one of our most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MC_Orlando
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in this hotel. Although the room was small (and typical by European standards), the room was obviously just renovated and spottless. Everything was fresh and the fixtures modern, etc. It is ideally located by the Termini station giving great access to the entire city by Metro or bus. Although the area around the station is "rougher," the hotel was very clean, safe, and quiet. The staff was helpful and friendly, and the breakfast provided was typical for Europe and excellent in quality. We could not have asked for more given what our expectaions were. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christopoulos
Reviews.Content: It's a very good hotel. Marco in the reception is very helpful and kind!! You will love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful little hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: gypsy558
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated near the Termini Station. The well air conditioned room was very clean, crisp linens, shower had good water pressure and lots of closet space. The breakfast was typical fruit, sweets, meat and cheese with good fresh cappachino. At the front desk, Marco graciously helped us locate many sites with a map provided by the hotel. He gave recommendations for restaurants, the best gelato and how to get there. The beds were not the most comfortable but with a glass of vino we barely noticed. Our stay was a great way to begin our travels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend this to all”
Reviews.Author: JohnC84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night having booked on the internet from another part of Italy. This was one of the best value for money hotels we have stayed at. Its a 3 star but has the standard a 4 but with 3 star prices. Its always a worry before you get to your hotel, we need not have been.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: IL-PINE
Reviews.Content: Been to Rome for 10 days and been for 9 nights in the hotel. The hotel is situated near the Termini station and this has made it easy for us to take our luggage to and from the hotel. In fact we just carried them by foot. Despite being near the train station, it was reasonably quiet in the rooms. It also had very good air conditioning. The hotel has a very good service, the staff are friendly and the rooms are cleaned daily. The room is small but it is very romantic! ?The breakfast is served in the morning and is sort of a buffet breakfast. Food is good. I recommend this hotel since it is not expensive for Rome's hotels and is in my opinion worthy more than 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Gal_31
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Europe and we decided to go cheap on hotels since we figured we would be out for the most of the day. The service was pretty standard, they spoke English. The room was very small, just right for sleeping. The bathroom was small, just right for taking a shower. The Elevator was very helpful. The neighborhood is not great because it is near the Termini (terminal), it is very busy almost like a market place so it can get very loud. There is a nice family-owned restaurant next door/near by that had a good menu and we ate there twice. There is also an internet cafe across the street. The best thing I liked about the hotel was the price and the least thing I liked about the hotel was the location. I was satisfied with the hotel but I do regret staying here because it was our honeymoon. I would not recommend this hotel for people who are on their honeymoons, I would suggest spending extra money and stay at a nicer hotel where you can feel relaxed and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: travelerFlorida_USA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Serena is locted a couple of blocks from the entrance of the Termini in Rome. It is in a quiet street. The staff spoke English and were courteous and helpful. The rooms although small by US standards, were very nice and clean. The bathroom was big, plenty of hot water and very modern and clean. It is clear that this hotel has been remodeled recently. Breakfast is not served until 7:30 am so if you need to be on the road before then, you cannot get even a cup of coffee. All in all, a very nice hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gempfr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated, close to city center (20 min by foot) and really close to Termini station which is convenient to go to airport or take metro. Rooms are renovated, really clean, but not so big. Buffet breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: maroon_calling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 5 minutes away from Termini station, which is the main train station of Rome. It is also where the two metro lines meet, making it very convenient to get around. However, the surrounding area is quite rough, so it may not be ideal for everyone. The staff were all very friendly and spoke decent English. The room and especially the bathroom were very clean, which was important for me. The shower cubicle was a good size and shower itself very powerful. There were enough clean towels to go round. I stayed in a three bedded room, and it was not small as I imagined. There was a flat screen TV, minibar and a safe in the wardrobe as well. I left the windows open at night for fresh air, and it can get a bit noisy, as there is a restaurant across the road. But it didn't bother me and I slept through it. The breakfast was as expected, continential style. The staff do make sure there is always enough food. There is also a locked luggage room, which is very handy if you are leaving Rome in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend this!”
Reviews.Author: spurstotty
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central, cheap bed and breakfast to act as a base on our midweek break, and i think we landed on our feet with the Serena. Five minutes walk from the main railway station, fifteen minutes walk from the Colosseum or the Trevi Fountain. Recently refurbished, i could not fault the rooms or the attitude of all the staff. The rooms aren't the biggest in the world but only needed them to crash out in. Loved the lift!! original unfurbished open mesh lift, very 20's/30's at a guess! Basic continental breakfast but plenty of choice. No problems with any of the staff, the lady on reception spoke best english but even the men worked out my patchy italian! Would recommend it if you're on a budget, would go back there again. Well done Serena!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Roma Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: RomaTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Quite good hotel for the money you have to pay. The room is clean and not too noisy. While we stayed in the Hotel for some days in the beginning of August the airconditioning was working and the room was very comfortable for sleeping. The TV set (flatscreen TFT) offers a variety of stations such as Italian and Spanish channels along with BBC world, CNN and the german ARD channel. However, some of the channels showed in a quite "snowy/noisy" picture quality. This hotel have quite an interesing and old style lift which is a great fun to use. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful the reception desk is operated 24 hours a day. All the staff from the reception desk speak good English. The breakfast is good. Especially the cappucino you can order for free from the hotel staff or obtain from a self service machine. We only missed fruits in the breakfast buffet. The only negative thing to report about the room was the shower area. It had leaky door and the water was flowing out of the shower-cell furthermore the shower-head was quite "ugly" and was in need of urgent replacement. The hotel is very close to the central train station Roma Termini where you also have access to the Metro Lines A and B and a bus terminus for several routes to the Vatican and other sightseeing places and some shopping opportunities. You also have easy access to Tram Lines 5 and 14 which have a stop near the hotel too. If you want you even can walk to Vatican (approximately 20-25 minutes walking), Colosseum, Forum Romanum and other sights more close to the hotel. There are also some great and not too expensive Restaurants around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cityscramblers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in thin excellent hotel for one week. The rooms vere very nice and clean. The brekfast was great and the staff friendly. The hotel elevator was very "fancy". When we left the hotel they kept our luggage so we had time to jump around before our train left to the airport. The neighbourhood was very nice too, with lot off people and full off life. Off course there is some noice on the streets, but you are in Rome, and that is the way it should be. Also it's safe to walk around, no troubles at all. Strongly recomended by us Cityscramblers HKI Finland.

Reviews.Title: “awfull one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: elitis
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this Hotel. Lets summarize I stayed in the hotel just for one night and the reason was that the hotel is awfull. 1 Firstly the rooms are not just small but tiny. The bed (double not king size) occupies virtually the whole space. As you can see in the photo there is room only to stand nothing more. It is almost clistofovik 2 The bathroom was really dirty especially the shower as you can see from the photo 3. the heating was not working during the night and the room was like a fridge. When i complained to the reception were extremely rude to me 4 the breakfast is really basic with nothing worth of eating 5 the area of the hotel is really bad and dangerous after sunset 6 for 60 euros there more options in roma Please don't go there it will make your trip in beatiful roma a bad expirience

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kublaichan
Reviews.Content: We find the Hotel in an excellent location and the Hotel staffs are very helpful from the moment we arrive. I will certaintly go back and stay there again if i have the chance to go back to Rome. Is a good location to walk to any part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great room, better staff”
Reviews.Author: climbergirl76
Reviews.Content: We originally picked this hotel as part of a package and weren't sure what to expect. What we found was a hotel 2 blocks from the Termini station, and within walking distance of the several major sightseeing areas. The staff was very friendly, open and helpful (Marco in particular). They were all cheery and warm. The room was average size for a European hotel and very clean. The shower had good water pressure, although the water temperature in the late morning never got as warm as it did at non-peak showering times. The room had large windows with shades and we left them open throughout the day. The breakfast was good but simple fare. We would have come back to the Serena for our last night in Rome if we hadn't already booked another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Krutch77
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews on here i thought that this place was not going to be great. I was pleasantly surprised because it was a nice hotel in a good location. There are plenty of places to eat and shop around the hotel. The people there were all friendly and because of this we came back and stayed an extra night there when we got back from Napoli.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: HLF-E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family during my half-term in late Feb 2007. The hotel has an excellent location, which is very near the Termini station and many other attractions. I could walk to the Colosseum. Another plus for the hotel is its bathroom. Water pressure was good and the bathroom was quite new. However, the service there was really poor! All the staff I came across were rather rude, especially the female receptionist, though they spoke English quite well. Breakfast was alright. No kettles were provided in the hotel! The lift looks old but it worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Choice”
Reviews.Author: klosterangel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a 5 minute walk from Termini station giving easy access to buses/trains to the airports, the Metro and both sightseeing and service buses. The area has numerous cheap and cheerful Pizzerias and Trattorias. There were also a few small supermarkets where you could pick up drinks or snacks for during the day. My boyfriend and I were on a mini-break to occupy ourselves between Christmas and New Year. We picked the Serena as it was pretty much the cheapest place we could find that hadn't been slated on Trip Advisor. We were not too sure what to expect as the hotel was very cheap and guidebooks warn that the area around the train station is a little seedy. We were however pleasantly suprised by what was on offer. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, the rather quaint looking lift was in good working order and most importantly the room was clean, the bed comforable and we had room to swing a cat. The decor was a little faded but we had plenty of blankets, towels and even soap and shampoo provided. The room was cleaned and the bed re-made each day and we had more than enough hot water for two long showers every morning. Given our booking website had this listed as a 2* hotel we had expected less particularly in a capital city. We had booked bed and breakfast and were impressed with the spread on offer each morning . There was not a lot of variety (rolls with ham and cheese, croissants, cereal, yoghurt) but everything was fresh and tasty and , as you'd expect in Italy, they were serving some really nice coffee. If I was returning to Rome on a budget I'd definately consider staying at the Serena again provided I wasn't travelling alone. While the hotel is lovely the area around the Termini has a lot of people hanging around on corners at night. I wouldn't be too keen to make my way back to the Serena at night on my own. Having said that if I was with a group or my boyfriend again it would probably be my first choice. It's not fancy but if you are a little cash strapped it offers all the basics and a few extras you wouldn't normally expect from a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel in October. We were very disappointed. There was no air conditioner and with the windows opened there was so much noise we could not sleep. It is also in a bad neighborhood and we were worried about leaviing the windows opened. The blow dryer did not work and I asked the woman at the desk for one that did and I was told there were not any extras. Our friends staying at another hotel came to visit us and were not allowed to come to our room to see us, even with our permission. It is close to the train station but I would rather walk farther than sta;y in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to live dangerously.....”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome and we booked this hotel without knowing all the facts about this one. The advantages of this hotel is that is very close to the Termini Station and this is where it's end. The hotel is located in a dangerous area where hookers, drunks lie on the street. My wife was totally unsecured at night as well as myself. Also, the choices of quality restaurants are meagre in this area. The hotel is links to 2 others El Cheapo hotels in the same building and anybody can enter through the side door of the building so facilities security doesn't exist at Serena. On the good side, the room was clean. The lobby staffs were helpful but for more than 100Euros a night, you getting screw. Breakfast was basic with croissant, juice, bread, past date ham and warm yogurt. If I have to return to Rome, I would certainly avoid this one and stick to everything related to Best Western in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location/great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day break in Rome, My husband and I found this hotel to be everything we required for a short break. Staff very helpful with regard to directions and ideas for eating, drinking etc. Room was tastefully decorated, bathroom very nice, air conditioning and mini bar. Breakfast was served in a room on the same floor. (selection of hams , cheeses, croissants, bread and rolls. Tea, coffee, fruit juices and cereals were all available in abundance.) Overall we had a brilliant time and would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “don't trust photos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the serena hotel in july 2005. my brother was getting married so all family came over and stayed at different hotels. This was one of the worse ones that i stayed in. when i was looking at website on this hotel it stated a bar and restaurant. Totally not true the bar you see in the photos is where they serve breakfast,used for tea and coffee, only open for few hours in morning,closed any other time. The bread is like bricks,that hard. There is no restaurant more lies, just a room for where the breakfast is served. The lift is very old, didn't feel safe at all. Do not use the phone we got a massive bill, hardly used it as my family was in the province. The staff are not too bad although they went mad when i was showing my brothers the room for only 5 minutes. The local newsagent shop next door to hotel is not friendly at all. The bathroom isnt too bad and the room itself is alright, just not what i expected at all, very disappointed. There is many hotels on this street. no offense to transvestites but of all hotels they stood outside our hotel. I didn't feel this was a safe street compared to my familys hotel. one good aspect of this hotel it was very near the termini station. oh yes if anyone is going to rome get a taxi from the airport and ask fee prior. we got a bus then metro BIG MISTAKE there is no lifts and escalators. We had to drag our suitcases up and down many steps not a nice experience when you first land. Well if you go to this hotel expect less than you see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome stayed at Hotel Serena which was a great location. Handy to trains and buses and cheap restaurants. Very friendly and helpful staff, rooms small but clean and good breakfast.Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great time @ Serna”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hotel Serna in Rome.Stayed there from the 28th December until the 1st January.My wife and I had a super time there,the staff were ever so helpful and pleasant.I have read reviews about the air conditioning not working.When we arrived in Rome the weather was cold and damp but the room was nice and warm so this time of the year was not a problem concerning air conditioning.The room was a bit on the small side but was tidy and clean. It was handy being so close to the main terminal for getting around using either the buses or metro.Some nice little restaurants in the same street as the hotel at reasonable prices.All in all we had a good time at the Hotel Serna and would like to thank the staff for all their help.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: tuffnut
Reviews.Content: A big plus for this hotel is that it is located near Termini station (about 2 blocks) and it is very accessible to busses. This factor is very important when you dont like to take cabs since it can be a rip off. The hotel lobby is very small, but the receptionists are helpful and friendly. Rooms are located on the third floor. We got a room for double occupancy, and what's supposedly a king size bed is actually 2 twin beds put together.. and you can actually feel the 3" gap in the middle when you lay on it. The rooms and the bathrooms are clean although they are not as spacious as they are in the pictures. The only problem is that the air conditioning does not seem to work at night. We are pretty much out for the whole day and when we come back at night the AC seem to be working. However in the middle of the night it stops working. You then need to open the windows, and the noise from outside is so loud it will be impossible for you to get back to sleep. Breakfast is served at the hotel which consists of danish, croissants, yogurt, cereal and coffee. We paid 90EURO per night which i think is high. I would recommend this hotel for under 70EURO and A/C fixed. But for 90EURO or more, I would try to look for better hotels around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laiyee
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at this hotel. It is less than a 5 minute walk from Termini station, which was useful because we used Termini to catch a lot of Rome's city buses. Although we were close to the train station, the area seemed very safe, and we did not have any trouble in terms of safety. There are many restaurants, internet cafes and laundromats on the street, as well as a gelateria two doors down, which was convenient! The Coloseum and ruins were a 15 minute walk away, and aside from taking a bus to see the Vatican, we easily walked to all of the other tourist sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was very good -- an assortment of breads and danishes, cereals, yogurt, cheese, tea/coffee and juice. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom (ensuite) was big and clean. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for those who want to stay near Termini”
Reviews.Author: Nadia_Elamin
Reviews.Content: The location is the the key value of the hotel. Besides being close to central station and Piazza Republica, there is a self-service laundromat 3 doors down for those who pack light and need to clean their clothes. I stayed here two different times, and it is true that in the first room on the 3rd floor, the air conditioning didn't work (even though reception was fully cooled) but in the second room on the second floor it did. The second floor also had small fridges filled with cool beverages and I found the bedroom and the room in general to be nicer. I did notice a difference in reception between the people. The man in the morning was excellent in making you feel welcome and in general had a cheery attitude. His customer service was exceptionally good. The younger man during the evening shift was also pleasant, but the woman is not as welcoming or easy going . Whichever room you stay in, it is still good. The cleaning is done well, the water pressure is good, there is a TV with English channels (BBC, & CNN), and the breakfast is very good. I think the price per value is a good deal. The hotel location is great for those who want to stay near central station. I liked staying near the station because you can buy a day pass and can catch any bus wherever you are that will take you back to central station or to another stop where you can catch bus that will take you there. Also there are lots of internet points, 2 self-service laundrymats, a couple of good restaurants, and some good bar/cafes near the hotlel.

Reviews.Title: “No Airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: LondonDesa
Reviews.Content: We arrived in hotel only to find that air conditioning was broken. They were not very nice about the situation. It was a holiday weekend and they knew it would be hard for us to find another hotel. They only took 5 euros off the price. The lady manager was very rude and unaccomidating. The man that was at the desk in the day was very nice. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was nice. The rooms were so stuffy that it was very difficult to sleep and they offered no fans. The hotel was in good condition, but the air conditioning situation was not taken care of properly and affected our whole trip in a negative way.

Reviews.Title: “Look somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay at Hotel Serena in early June. The air conditioner never worked the time we were there. This meant we had to keep our window open during the night. The street is very loud and this caused poor sleep. The manager was very rude to us when we complained several times about the lack of air conditioning. She told me one evening that if we did not like it...we could pack up and move out to the streets. On the bright side, the morning breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning did not work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome - spent 5 nights at the Hotel Serena, Via Principe Amedeo 64, Roma, 00185. Cleanliness OK They sell the rooms with air conditioning, but when we arrived the air conditioning was not working in our room - No 427. Complained and requested a room in which air conditioning was working. Checked out 2 other rooms on 4 th floor. Air conditioning not working in any of them. It was very hot when we were there and therefore had to have windows open at night - very noisy from traffic. This spoiled our holiday. They kept the air conditioning working at the reception - so don't be fooled. We complained and got a reduction of 10 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good, middle priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwmpet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about 400 meters from Termini station in a rather busy street, but the rooms have double glazing. So the traffic noise is not too intrusive. There are smaller rooms with a somewhat larger bathroom (like 311) and lager rooms with a smaller bathroom (like 310). The room is clean and the beds are very good (box spring mattresses). By Italian standards the breakfast is very good. The airco does not always work, which was no problem during our stay in the second week of May. The only (minor) problem is the refrigerator, which hardly cool the beverages. The city center is in walking distance and there is an express bus to the Vatican near the train station. The neighbourhood is not that bad. We booked via Venere, so there were no additional costs. Recommendable

HotelInfo.Name: Serena Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo, 64, 00185 Rome, Italy
